column5: You guys know me pretty well by now and know that come late October, the fishing gear get's put away and hunting becomes my main focus, just like steelheaders, walleye and musky hunters in the fall   Last year was not able to go and this year, only able to go weekends.  This was our third year in new territory... we figured it out pretty good   Results was 2 spikes for the 4 of us   First one was 110Lbs and second was 125Lbs field dress... As shown in my previous reports  Today was the day to get our second guest for the freezer   and the tally for the 4 of us was 23Lbs of pure goodness each total  This is all good but the main reason for posting... is the meal my daughter and I got tonight... you guys remember the venison recipe I had posted three years ago... well had some steaks marinaded for a while, prepped the veggies and tatters and here is the results  Not that I want to rub it in  Veggies have been drenched in extra olive oil, salt & pepper, chilly powder and a tea spoon of honey mustard    Steaks drowning in marinade    Tatters being blanched    Tatters drying    The pans getting hot    Tatters and veggies frying    Steaks droppped in the pan    Flipped... other side    End results    Cook to perfection.... medium rare.... ummmm    Next on the menu is pepperettes and spaghetti sauce Hope you enjoy Leechman
Nice... Steaks look amazing..When is dinner?
Ya right.  Looks like liver and onions to me.
Looks like it was about 2 hours ago.
Looks good Leechman, now you make me hungry at 1:30 in the morning
That is a meal fit for a king!   Deerloaf for dinner tonight?

yano, make another post like this and I'm going to hafta round up some other members and come raid your freezer. just saying  -and btw, we're gonna make you fry up some medallions for us while we're emptying said freezer of anything venison related
